page.title: 13EDUCATION, contd.
page.content: Prior to entry to the village school many children attend the local play- group which is held on three mornings each week in the village hall. Some children attend nursery schools in Hitchin. After the age of eleven the children leave the village school to attend secondary schools in Hitchin. There are a few children who do not attend the local schools. There are a number of children from the village who are at colleges of further education. Offley Place, once the home of the Salusbury family, is now owned by Hertfordshire County Council. Earlier this century it was a teacher training college but now is a residential centre for in-service education in the county. Due to financial constraints its use is curtailed at present.
